For the crispy pork: 1 x 150g/5½oz pork fillet, cut into thin strips
salt and freshly ground black pepper
For the dressing: salt and freshly ground black pepper
For the salad: handful fresh mixed herbs (such as parsley, dill, chives)
To serve: 1 lime, cut into wedges, to garnish

steps: For the crispy pork, heat the oil in a frying pan over a medium-high heat. Season the pork strips on both sides with salt and freshly ground black pepper and fry for 8-10 minutes.
Add the sesame seeds and red onion and fry for a further five minutes. Add the honey, stir well and cook for one minute, or until the pork is completely cooked through.
Meanwhile, for the dressing, place all the dressing ingredients into a bowl and mix well.
For the salad, place the cheese, onion, orange and herbs into a bowl and mix well. Pour over the dressing and stir to coat.
To serve, place the salad onto a plate and top with the crispy pork. Serve with lime wedges and toasted ciabatta.
title: Vietnamese-style crispy pork and citrus salad
